query: What did we decide about authentication?

items.name: Alice
items.content: I think we should use JWT tokens for authentication. They're stateless and work well with our microservices architecture.

items.name: Bob
items.content: Agreed on JWT. We can use the python-jose library for token handling. It has good support for RS256 signing.

items.name: Alice
items.content: Let's also add refresh token support. Short-lived access tokens (15 min) with longer refresh tokens (7 days) for better security.

items.name: Charlie
items.content: Don't forget we need to handle token revocation. Maybe a Redis blacklist for invalidated tokens?

items.name: Bob
items.content: Good point Charlie. We should also implement rate limiting on the auth endpoints to prevent brute force attacks.
